item.source: How do i add commands and objects? :(

item.title: How do i add commands and objects? :(
item.dc:creator: @cheese8 cheese8
item.description:
@cheese8 wrote:

objects:

search for this in your client:

public void Addaobject

if you dont find this, you should be able to add the void im showing you under any other void…

paste this under the void i showed you if you found it (of any other void if you didnt find it):

public void house() { makeGlobalObject(3239, 3413, 11550, 0, 10);// from cheese8 }

to quickly describe this, the first 2 numbers (3239 and 3413) are just X and Y coordinates of the object of your choice. the 11550 is the object’s id. NEVER change the 10 at the end. the 0 is just the direction the object is facing. change it to -1, -2, or -3 for different positions…

lastly, search:

public boolean process

add this under that:

house();

and your all set.

tell me if you have any problems

Read full topic

item.title: How do i add commands and objects? :(
item.dc:creator: @ass_woop ass woop
item.description:
@ass_woop wrote:

[quote=“cheese8, post:2, topic:164535”]really you shouldnt even ask about commands but ill help…

for commands:

in client, search for:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("

you should seem something like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2)

or maybe this:

[code]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”))code]
but when you find something that looks like one of those, you can add a new one and make a command out of it.

ill show you how to get to 99 in every skill by using this command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2)

copy and paste this after a command in the client:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2) { addSkillXP(986000000, 0); addSkillXP(986000000, 1); addSkillXP(986000000, 2); addSkillXP(986000000, 3); addSkillXP(986000000, 4); addSkillXP(986000000, 5); addSkillXP(986000000, 6); addSkillXP(986000000, 7); addSkillXP(986000000, 8); addSkillXP(986000000, 9); addSkillXP(986000000, 10); addSkillXP(986000000, 11); addSkillXP(986000000, 12); addSkillXP(986000000, 13); addSkillXP(986000000, 14); addSkillXP(986000000, 15); addSkillXP(986000000, 16); addSkillXP(986000000, 17); addSkillXP(986000000, 18); addSkillXP(986000000, 19); addSkillXP(986000000, 20); addSkillXP(986000000, 21); addSkillXP(986000000, 22); addSkillXP(986000000, 23); addSkillXP(986000000, 24); }

now when you type in ::master in game, you get 99 in everything (this could be over 99 though)

the “playerRights >= 2” simply means that if you are an admin, only you can use this command. change it to 1 for mods and up, or 0 for everyone.

ill add objects next

if you dont understand somethin let me know…[/code][/quote]very good, nicely explained good job

Read full topic

item.title: How do i add commands and objects? :(
item.dc:creator: @cheese8 cheese8
item.description:
@cheese8 wrote:

really you shouldnt even ask about commands but ill help…

for commands:

in client, search for:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("

you should seem something like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2)

or maybe this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master"))

but when you find something that looks like one of those, you can add a new one and make a command out of it.

ill show you how to get to 99 in every skill by using this command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2)

copy and paste this after a command in the client:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2) { addSkillXP(986000000, 0); addSkillXP(986000000, 1); addSkillXP(986000000, 2); addSkillXP(986000000, 3); addSkillXP(986000000, 4); addSkillXP(986000000, 5); addSkillXP(986000000, 6); addSkillXP(986000000, 7); addSkillXP(986000000, 8); addSkillXP(986000000, 9); addSkillXP(986000000, 10); addSkillXP(986000000, 11); addSkillXP(986000000, 12); addSkillXP(986000000, 13); addSkillXP(986000000, 14); addSkillXP(986000000, 15); addSkillXP(986000000, 16); addSkillXP(986000000, 17); addSkillXP(986000000, 18); addSkillXP(986000000, 19); addSkillXP(986000000, 20); addSkillXP(986000000, 21); addSkillXP(986000000, 22); addSkillXP(986000000, 23); addSkillXP(986000000, 24); }

now when you type in ::master in game, you get 99 in everything (this could be over 99 though)

the “playerRights >= 2” simply means that if you are an admin, only you can use this command. change it to 1 for mods and up, or 0 for everyone.

ill add objects next

if you dont understand somethin let me know…

—EDIT—
by the way thanks ass woop
